values: To admonish someone is to tell them you disapprove of their behavior.
The teacher admonished Mark because he was chewing gum in class.
v. to speak to in a way that expresses disapproval or criticism 反对，批评
v. to tell or urge to do something 告诫

- vt. 劝告, 训诫
- (温和地)责备，轻责

时 态:  
admonished, admonishing, admonishes 

名 词:  
admonishment
to warn of a fault, to reprove gently, but seriously
vt.劝告,训诫,（温和地）责备,轻责
劝告， 训诫， 警告
